title: Incredibly admirable
text: Yesterday (13:22) Breadvan72 said: (eg "All Jews are mean with money. Oh, except some of my best friends are Jewish and they always buy me a pint"). My point is that people are people, some good, some bad, and tend not to be goodies or baddies because they belong to a particular group. To me the Jewish community are a difficult one to figure out.Many years ago I was walking home with a friend at about 05:00 from a long Friday night out. Wandering through the streets of Stamford Hill, it was a beautiful morning, blue skies, hardly any traffic, no other pedestrians, a really warm, pleasant happy come-down walk home.Then out from his front door trots a full orthodox Jewish lad - I guess late 20s asking if we can help him.'Sure' I asked, 'what's the problem?''We forgot to top up our electricity meter yesterday and now our timer cooked food isn't cooking.''OK' I said reaching into my pocket to pull out some money, 'How much do you need?''No - you don't understand - it's the Sabbath and we are forbidden to touch these things...'So I challenged him a little 'OK, so your God has forbidden you to touch this technology on a Sabbath, but you're quite happy to invite me into to your home and take the wrath of your God?''Yes' was his reply.'You hypocritical
